The exams are completed timely but still, during the covid period, the management did show unnecessary haste in conducting exams which was a major setback on their part since the class was started late due to covid and our overall curriculum was tightly packed with seminars, projects, reports and exams. There are a lot of student clubs and societies in which students can enrol. You'll have a decent interaction with your seniors, so you won't feel left out in the college.

Name: Bhakti Sharma
Heading: Get an inside perspective about JNTUH
Review:
The Training & Placement Cell of Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University is a section of UIIC dedicated to offering all feasible help to its top-ranked students as well as satisfying the demands of enterprises. The Training & Placement Cell is led by a professor who serves as the Training & Placement Officer in Charge, with Student Placement Coordinators assisting him. The cell hosts pre-placement seminars, online examinations, internship awareness programmes, and training sessions for students in order to familiarise them with the business and assist them in grooming and becoming industry-ready.
The 2021 placements at JNTUH are excellent. However, the placement results for the year 2021 have not yet been disclosed, however, Microsoft has awarded the institute the highest CTC of INR 41 LPA.
Moreover, 64 companies participated in the placement drive of 2020 some of them are Amazon, Oracle, TCS, Invesco, etc.

Name: Rahul

Name: Samarth Nautiyal
College: University Institute of Engineering and Technology -[UIET]
Heading: Still in 2nd year
Review: Campus life is great! Students come from all over the country(though prominently North Indians), there is huge diversity. Goonj is our annual fest but you will find many fests going round the year, from technical to cultural. Then our library is also great, AC Joshi library is the library of the whole PU which can provide you books of any genre or any field you are interested in. Sports is something PU is known for, there must be a reason if it's awarded for sports. We have great facilities for sports, tennis court, hockey ground, football ground, basketball court and the list goes on. Apart from all, like other engineering colleges, there is a range of clubs.. from photography to alumni. Osmium, the theatre one, is the oldest among all the clubs

Name: Himanshu pandgre
Heading: interesting College

Name: Muskan Gupta
Heading: Software Engineering At DTU
Review: The course curriculum of software engineering is very nice. It has been designed keeping in view the software requirements in the industry. All the important subjects are covered in the curriculum. We can also take a minor of any course we like to do. There are plenty of subjects to choose from. The faculties are very well educated. The exams are conducted in the form of minor tests and surprise tests and class tests and projects.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology - [SVNIT]
Heading: College review
Review:
The fees structure for the Btech course is approximately 5,40,000 INR. There are many government scholarships available which students can apply for.
For students whose family income is between 1-5 lakh have to pay only 1/3rd of the fees, and those with income less than 1 lakh have to pay nothing.

Name: JAHIRUDDIN MOLLA
Heading: My experience in WBSU
Review:
I thought biochemistry might be a good subject for M.sc and I thought it will be a good subject to get a job in the technical field.
We had 5 professors in the Biochemistry department and we had around 36 students so we had around one professor for 6-7 students.

Our professors are very qualified. They have done a Ph.D. & won several awards in their field. They gave us all the study material needed in post-graduation. They are very willing to teach us practical so we understand the subject deeply.

They did some audiovisual classes and organized several seminars both online & offline.
We had one final exam every semester. You have to study a lot to pass & get good marks.

Name: Prateek Martin
Heading: IMS- Yes or No
Review:
1) Through the application form I opted for my course. (B.B.A).
2) There are many faculty. All faculty are best. Good quality teaching. The number of students is approximately 350 or more in my course. There are enough faculty for students.
3) Some are CA, Some are Ph.D. Teachers are the best you can get. Quality teaching.
4) Do to all covid problems exams are all late. Internal exams are good on time but easy to pass. External exams are also easy to pass.

Name: Rimmy jain
College: Fairfield Institute of Management and Technology - [FIMT]
Heading: Good college at reasonable fees
Review: I chose this course because I have always wanted to become a teacher. B.ed help in to get private and goverment teaching job. All faculty members for our subject are nice and helpful. Few faculty members help in getting jobs also by their own contacts in school or alumni. Qualification of teachers are good and most of are M.ed or P.hd holder. The teaching method is mostly based on practical knowledge.

Name: Tanish
Heading: Is PIET considerate
Review: The college campus is actually great. Recently there was a feat called carbuncle which was awesome and we enjoyed it a lot, there are so many fests and workshops organized in this college which is actually a great way to learn and move forward in your life.

Name: Chirag Routaray
Heading: Silicon Institute of Technology, Bhubaneswar
Review:
My ambition is to be a programmer, thus Computer Science and Engineering is the best course available.

The ratio of Faculty Advisor to Student is = 1:15. And ratio of student to teacher in 1st year is approx. = 1:60.

Teachers are highly qualified, some of them even were a part of IITs, and thus they've high-quality teaching methods which are helpful for even those who didn't have pre-requisite knowledge for college level.

Silicon is well reputed for its scrict exam time schedule and conduct. And the term exam is a bit leveled as it aims to improve the students and shape them to become ready to implement it in real world.

But there's a downside i.e some faculties don't have proper teaching skills, so students have to struggle a bit, but most teachers are highly better than average.

Name: Abhir
College: P.U. Swami Sarvanand Giri Regional Centre - [PUSSGRC]
Heading: PUSSGRC UIET HOSHIARPUR REVIEW
Review: Faculty members are really helpful. They guide us a lot. The college provides good labs and courses are generalized in such a way that students could understand easily. All the teachers are experienced and are quite knowledgeable. Mid sem exams take place in a month's time and difficulty is set to average to hard varying subject to subject.

Name: Chinmay
Heading: My College Review till date
Review:
The KIITFEST is the annual fest of the institute and is held in the month of December, but due to the pandemic, the college did not host the fest in the past 2 years. The tech fest is also embedded in the annual fest here at KIIT.
The library is a full AC library that is open for students round the clock (24/7) and has around a 1.1million books including reference books with textbooks and over 4million+ E-journals etc. There is a photocopy service as well which opens from 9 AM to 6 PM on working days.
Also, you can remote excess the library through RemoteXs software which is not much developed but does the work sometimes.
There is an online IEL service for students where they can avail themselves of many books and journals online and many more facilities.
KIIT offers immense opportunities for students interested in sports and fitness and was even a host for Khelo India 2020.
There are sports facilities on almost all the campuses and the timings are typically from 6 AM-9AM and 3PM-9PM.

Name: Bijita Panja
Heading: Best  college for Agriculture (ICAR affiliated)
Review: Yearly tuition fees Rs170000/.  Admission fees Rs10000/. Hostel lodging fees Rs55000/ and flooding fees Rs30000/. Veg and nonveg both are available at Hostel. Scholarship Rs 15000.00 per years for students secured 80%marks in both10th and 12th examinations

Name: Kunal Dagar
College: Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies - [MRIIRS]
Heading: College Review
Review: The fees for my course was initially around 221000 but as I scored 82% in class 12th so I got 25% scholorship in the tution fee and my fees got to around 207000 per year . The scholarship criteria is very simple if you got more than 80% you will get 25% scholorship, for 85% it's 50 % and above 90% it's may be 90% or 100% but in the tution fee .

Name: Derrick David

Name: SATHIAH KUMAR

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Expect everything from the college except internships and placements
Review:
Courses are good and related to your allotted branch. The CS branches in the college(CSE, IT, CE) have almost similar courses.
Coming to the faculty, you have qualified professors, with MTech and PhDs, some from the IITs but they won't be teaching you all the courses, you will be getting assistant teachers(including MTech students) for half of your courses. Senior professors are well versed with their teaching and won't disappoint you, just following their lectures can get you good grades in your semester, but the assistant teachers are pathetic in their work. In my five-semester experience, I have been getting at least one or two such teachers each semester. They are irregular in taking classes, bad in their teaching ways, and don't even care. MTech students just take classes for the sake of a stipend. I would advise you to avoid such teachers, if possible.
We have a mid sem exam, 2 quizzes, and an end sem exam each semester. Exams are easy to pass for most subjects, previous year papers FTW.

 College also conducts sports in which have a tournament of cricket football with other local colleges.

The total cost for the course would be around 70000 rupees minus other fees. I applied for the minorities Scholarship scheme provided by the Telangana government which paid for my complete course there are also other scholarships students can try. There were no jobs on campus. You can work outside part-time. The college won't provide any financial assistance we have to pay complete fees.

Initially, it will be a challenge to manage all your works and study but as time will pass you will acquire that very important skill of time management.

Review:

Dav being a government college under central universityhnbgu has a very experienced and knowledgeable faculty, lots of teachers in lots of branches, the students to teacher ratio is about 50:1 meaning for every 50 students there's 1 teacher available and for every branch irrespective of the student's ratio there never has been shortage or absence of teachers, they give the best for the students.
The exams are taken semester wise, 2 semesters in a year with internal and external in each semester and the exams are conducted timely without any delay 
The exam level is moderate, any student who has taken classes regularly can pass easily with good marks. And during the corona period exams were conducted online but were timely and despite having lots of students the college conducted the exams in an appreciable manner.

And we had 5 professors. So we have one professor per 10 students approx. All of our professors are highly qualified. They teach us with a lot of willingness. We had two seminars on different topics of mathematics.
We had six semesters in total so we had to give 6 final exams. Other than the semester we had an internal class test.

Name: Saarthak Kapoor
Heading: All about RIT
Review: Campus life is awesome if you have the right group of friends. There are many things to explore, many clubs ( both cultural and technical) to take part in, many sports to play and many fests to attend. The campus is beautiful and has all the facilities one can aspire for. Sports is really good with the facility for cricket, basketball, football, table tennis, tennis, carrom, chess, volleyball and much more. A gym is there on the college campus. Apart from this, there are many innovative clubs for students to learn more skills and to showcase their talents 3 major fests are organized every year. One is Kannada Rajyotsav which is the regional fest of Karnataka. One is Imperial which happens in February. It is a technical fest and students get to know lots of things about it. And the best one is Udbhav which happens in April. It is the best cultural fest among all VTU colleges. Many events, DJ nights and co-curricular activities, treasure hunts, shows, dramas, dances, music, etc are organized in it.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Very good-PGDAV

All faculties were Ph.D. holder and their teaching methods were very practical.
Exams were there every 6th month and daily study of 4 hours can get you through all the exams happily.

Name: Abhay

The college lacks a few sports facilities but still has football, volleyball, TT, badminton courts, and cricket nets for practice.

The student-faculty ratio was 1 professor per 6 students. We had to do a lot of practical classes in 3 years. Our professor used to do a lot of practical classes. And we used to do seminars in our department where everyone participate in audiovisual studies.

All of our professors have done Ph.D. and they were very helpful.

We had to give one final exam every year but our professors did take a lot of class tests and they provided a lot of mock question papers. 

If anyone study regularly exams were not difficult to pass.

Name: Dinesh kumar

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: Babu Banarasi Das Northern India Institute of Technology - [BBDNIIT]

Name: Priti Chaudhary
Heading: Fergusson college for BSc admission and Campus placement
Review:

The whole campus ambiance is marvelous and also the buildings. Best college

Name: Sreelekha Vuppala
College: Vishwa Vishwani Institute of Systems and Management - [VVISM]
Heading: Experience in VVISM
Review:

Name: Rahul Tuteja
Heading: NSIT, doesn't sound familiar , you should know it

Name: maroof alam
Heading: Brighter And Nicer FUTURE in Quantum University
Review:

Name: Yogesh Rangi
Heading: NSIT Placements
Review: my interest in satellite communication and electronics hardware led my ways to ECE, ECE is the oldest and most reputed branch of NSIT All of the faculty are highly professional and have great knowledge regarding the subject they teach, all faculty are the member of IEEE and have their own research paper printed on IEEE,  Faculty: Student = 1:70 during my tenure, most of the faculty is a Ph.D. in their respected field with tons of teaching experience. They make study and concept very easy to understand and able to convey the visualization behind the concept, so even though the exam paper is tough (mid sem & End sem ) though I was able to score good marks

Name: YASHA SHARMA
Heading: The campus life that you see in movies

For more details, you can go to du.ac.in the website. The placements in this college are not that attractive/ lucrative. Honestly, it totally depends on how your placement cell is working. Name: Bhivyanshu Singh Arya
Heading: DTU : a complete review

Name: Shubham Kumar

You can Work on any projects during intership

Name: Ishant pawar
Heading: NSIT college review

There are several societies in our college Like BHR AND TEAM DEADALOUS for making bikes and cars , we have The Debating society and we have drama society Ashwamedh , cresscendo the music society and many more.

Name: Student (Anonymous)

Name: Ankit Upadhyay

every student has to either go for an in-house internship provided by the college, or any other internship (either from college or off campus) and provide a detailed project about the work or achievements he got during that period which is considered for grading the student in coming semester.

Name: Neiketa sinha
Heading: ESICMCH Hyderabad: The best college in Town
Review:
I chose MBBS for the sole reason that I love to read about the human body in humongous detail. Honestly, if one joins MBBS for the purpose of moneymaking then I suggest you don't because you would be exhausted one day.

Here at ESIC, student: teacher ratio is pretty good and maintained. Every 12 student has one mentor, for every subject. Talking about first-year subjects, the cadaveric dissection lab has 9 students per cadaver. So this makes it beneficial to learn anatomy and helpful in surgery too. Second-year onwards there are regular postings till 4th year after which you become an intern and have to serve according to the band signed.

All the faculty here are either Ph.D. or Doctor themselves. Well trained and excellent at dispensing their service well. We've seminars, SGD( Short Group Discussion), SDL( Self Directed Learning), and regular PCT( part completion Tests) to improve our learning.

It takes regular studies to clear these exams. MBBS cannot be passed by studying one night before exam.

Name: Vaibhav
Heading: ESIC hyderabad- A rapidly emerging college with a very postive future
Review:

Name: Dishant Kaamra

Name: Apoorva Rathore
Heading: Mody University - An institute for overall development
Review:
The tuition fee is approximately INR 250000/yr. If one chooses to live in on-campus hotels, then it would cost an additional INR 200000/yr (for a double seater room) approximately. However, if one opts for off-campus hostels, then the hostel charges may vary from as low as INR 40000/yr (for a triple seater) to as moderate as INR 80000/yr (for a single-seater).
There are various criteria to avail scholarship. For instance, Toppers of any state board or central board can get a 100% waiver for a full term. A candidate scoring more than 95%, in PCM or PCB in class 12, or JEE Mains rank of up to 150000, or NEET rank up to 50000, or MEET rank up to 50 can get a 70% waiver for a full term. As the PCM or PCB score, JEE Mains rank, NEET rank, or MEET rank decreases, the percentage of waiver also decreases. 
Besides, if more than one sibling is studying at Mody University or Mody school, then there is a provision of a 10% tuition fee waiver. Find more at modyuniversity.ac.in/pdf/scholarship.pdf
